metadata.template_skill: Student shades parts of a bar to create a fraction equivalent to a 2/3-family reference

telemetry_data.mastery_skill: Student can create an equivalent fraction by shading the correct number of parts (2/3 family)

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar showing one-third. Create an equivalent fraction using sixths.

prompt.text: Shade sections to show a fraction equivalent to 1/3.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look at how much of the reference bar is shaded, then match that same amount in the sixths bar.

Let's think about this together. The reference bar shows one-third shaded. Now look at your sixths bar - you need to shade enough sixths to equal that same amount. Compare the size of the shaded area to what you see in the reference bar.

Let me walk you through creating this equivalent fraction. The reference bar shows one-third shaded. Now we need to figure out how many sixths equal one-third. Look at the sixths bar - it has 6 equal parts instead of 3. That means each third contains 2 sixths. So to show one-third using sixths, we need to shade 2 sections. That gives us two-sixths, which equals one-third. That's how we create equivalent fractions - we find how many of the smaller parts fit into the same amount of space.
